abstract.text: Incorporate the system text-selection experience into your custom text UI in UIKit.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Adopting system selection UI in custom text views

inlineContent.text: People can enter text into your app in a variety of ways, such as typing, copy and paste, or dictation. iOS 17 introduces changes to the system UI for inserting and selecting text to provide a more seamless text experience.
If your app handles text input through standard UIKit views such as
or
, your app automatically uses the system UI for inserting and selecting text. This system selection UI includes the following elements:
The text cursor that indicates the insertion point of the text
The highlight behind the selected text
Selection handles for selecting ranges of text
The loupe for placing the text cursor in large bodies of text
If you have a highly customized UI for displaying text, you can adopt this system selection UI in your UIKit app. In most cases involving text selection display and interaction, use

, which includes the system selection UI and standard gesture recognizers to let people modify the selection state in your custom text view. If you want to implement the selection gestures yourself, but still want to indicate text selection using the standard system UI, use
instead. This article describes the steps for adopting

content.text: Add the system selection UI to a custom text view

inlineContent.text: If your app handles text input through a custom text view that builds on

When your custom text view becomes active or becomes first responder, activate the interaction.

code: // Activate the interaction when the text view becomes active.

inlineContent.text: When a person interacts with text in your custom text view, notify the interaction as the state of the text selection changes.

code: // Notify the interaction when the text selection changes.

inlineContent.text: After you call
, the interaction retrieves the latest information about the current text selection from
so it can redraw the selection UI.

content.text: Customize the system selection UI elements

inlineContent.text: You might want further customization to the system selection UI to match your custom text view’s style and behavior. You can customize various properties on
The
property represents the text cursor. You can customize the state of the text cursor’s blinking animation.
The
property represents the highlight behind the selected text. You can customize the shape of the selection to draw a custom highlight.
The
property represents the selection handles for selecting ranges of text. You can customize the appearance of the handles by defining a custom shape or specifying the orientation of the handles.

content.text: Enhance text-cursor placement with the text loupe

inlineContent.text: Your custom text view can also display the system UI for the loupe, which people use for placing the text cursor in large bodies of text. When a person interacts with your custom text view in a way that you want to display the loupe, such as a pan gesture, call
on a
object. The system animates the presentation and placement of the loupe according to the starting point you provide. Call
to track the movement of the loupe as a person moves the text cursor, and
to hide the loupe and end the session.
The following code shows how to show the loupe using a pan gesture recognizer.

code: // Show a loupe with a pan gesture.

inlineContent.text: When your custom text view becomes inactive or resigns first responder status, make sure to deactivate the interaction.

code: // Deactivate the interaction when the text view becomes inactive.

abstract.text: Incorporate the system text cursor into your custom text UI in AppKit.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Adopting the system text cursor in custom text views

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A view that draws the standard system insertion point in a piece of text.
An interface you use to draw the insertion point in a piece of text.
An object that displays an editable text area in your interface.
A set of methods for interacting with the text input system and enabling features in documents.
An interaction that provides text selection gestures and UI to custom text views.
An object that manages the presentation of the system magnifier at the location you specify.
Creates a new loupe session and displays the loupe at the specified location in your view.
Hides the loupe and cleans up any session-related state.
Moves the loupe to the specified point in the session’s associated view.
An object that provides the system UI for displaying text selection.
The view that draws the caret at the text insertion point.
The view that draws the selection handles for the selected text.
The view that draws the selection highlight behind the rendered text.
Tells the system to update the selection UI to match the current selection state.
The text input object that manages the selection.
An interface you use to draw custom the selection handles for ranges of text.
An interface you use to provide a custom highlight UI behind the selected text.
A scrollable, multiline text region.
Configure the system keyboard, create your own keyboards to handle input, or detect key presses on a physical keyboard.
